summary: The 'Creative Relief and Expensing for Audio and Television Enterprises Act' (CREATE Act) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It primarily focuses on expanding the ability to expense certain qualified productions. Key changes include increasing dollar limitations for qualifying productions, and extending the termination date for this provision to December 31, 2030. Furthermore, the bill introduces inflation adjustments for these dollar amounts, starting in 2026. These changes are applicable to productions commencing in taxable years ending after December 31, 2025.
